description: ERECTION OF A TWO STOREY SIDE EXTENSION AND ROOF TERRACE.
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The design of the proposed two storey side extension, specifically the rooftop terrace, which forms a flat roof, would be harmful to the character and appearance of the dwelling, due to the inappropriate design within the context of the main dwelling and the streetscene, as a whole. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policy CS14 of the Core Planning Strategy (2011) and Policies DMD2 and DMD3 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan (2014).

Reason : 2 - The inclusion of a rooftop terrace on the two storey side extension would be harmful to the residential amenity of the neighbouring dwellings, due to the intrusive views that it would create over the rear amenity space of the neighbouring dwelling to the south, no. 49 Ashridge Way. The nature of rooftop terraces and the typical uses that they provide for, means that the proposal would also adversely impact on neighbour amenity, by way of noise creation. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy DMD2 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan (2014).

Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The applicant/agent was informed of any issues arising during consideration of the application and how these could potentially be overcome but sufficient information was not forthcoming.
